body_html: @cooltopics Are you certain that the custom library was built and linked correctly? One potential cause for this problem is if the static initializers for Op and Kernel registration are "optimized" out of the final DLL. The /WHOLEARCHIVE option to link.exe might be useful here.
body_text: @cooltopics Are you certain that the custom library was built and linked correctly? One potential cause for this problem is if the static initializers for Op and Kernel registration are "optimized" out of the final DLL. The /WHOLEARCHIVE option to link.exe might be useful here.
body: @cooltopics Are you certain that the custom library was built and linked correctly? One potential cause for this problem is if the static initializers for Op and Kernel registration are "optimized" out of the final DLL. The [`/WHOLEARCHIVE` option to `link.exe`](https://stackoverflow.com/a/39715978/3574081) might be useful here.
